"HE EHEHEHEHEEH OOOKOKOKOKKOO HE EHEHEHEHE OOOKKKKKKK AH AHAHAHAH YOUHUHUHUHUHU HA AHAHH GAWWTTTT MEHEHEHEHEHEH AHAHAHAHAHAHAHAH YOUHUHUHU WINNNN HAHAHAHAHAH LAUAURRAHAHAHAHAHAHHHAHAH III GIVVEE EHAHAHAHAHAAH!!!!"

They had been slowly to react to the tickle attack in the laundry, because Lauren's spell had been cast against the clothes, not you. The instructors had thought it some entirely non-tickling prank all together. They had actually appologized to you after finally freeing you from the clothing mound Laura had buried you in. "Exactly!" Laura said, her voice filled with glee, "Right now all the instructors are busy refereeing the tickle matches. And since this wasn't even my spell imprisoning, but yours, probably cast while you practiced for your first match. "HE EHEHEH EHEHEHEH THEHEHEEYYYYY EHEHEHEHEHEHHEH GAWWDDDD NAWWOOWO TOOEESSH AHAHAAHAHAH PLEEEZZZ HEHE EHHEHEH NAWWOOOO TOEESSSSSSS THEYYEY HEHEHEHEHEH THEYEYEYEYYEY AREENN'TT HEHEHEHH COOOMINNGGNGN HEHEHEHEHEHEHEH THEYEYYY ARREENNN'T COMINGNNGNGN HEHEHEHEHEHEHEHE NAWWWTTTTT TOOESSSS AHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAAH!!!!!!"

1111.title: She tickles you

11111.content:
Normally, the very idea of casting a spell while laughing your head off is a foolish one. Magic requires pronouncing each syllable in a twisting, spidery sentence absolutely perfectly. Tickling pretty much rendered that impossible. It's why the first tickling magic was invented. But you aren't going to be your arch nemesis's tickle toy without putting up a fight. Despite each and every twitch of Laura's fingers sending peal after peal of laughter ringing from your mouth, you unleash a spell...

...and mangle it horribly.

"Ha ahaha," Laura laughs mockingly, "Did you really think anything was going to happen? You can't cast spells even when your not laughing like a baboon! Now you try and..." Her voice fell silent, and for the first time, her fingers stopped dancing on your soles. A thin, red line formed in mid-air, right over Laura's head, about six or seven feet in the air.

"A split in the fabric of reality," she whispered in horror, "Kevin, what have you done?"

Then there wasn't a line, but a hole, maybe an inch across and black as night. Slowly it got wider, like a door or window opening. You swallow hard, even as you catch your breath. This was bad. Very bad.

"Its your fault!" you bark, lungs still hurting from the tickling, "If you had just untied me instead of torturing me..."

"My fault!" Laura spat, "It was your damn spell! You're the one who..."

At that moment, black tendrils started streaming through the opening in the fabric. There were hundreds of them, each as thick as a man's arm. They looked like octopus tentacles, except they were totally smooth, with no suction cups at all. They quickly scoop up both you and Laura, lifting you high into the air. Their touch must dispel magic, because the ropes holding you vanished like mist. Unfortunately, with a tendril wrapped around each ankle and wrist, you have no more freedom then before.

"You moron!" Laura screams. Looking over, you see that she is in exactly the same predicament that you are. The creature (if that's what it is) effortlessly pulls her limbs spread eagle, turning her into a letter 'X'. All she can move is her head...and, unfortunately, her lips, "Its a tickle fiend! You've unleashed a damnable tickle fiend! I ought to he ehehe e eheheheheheeh nawwowooo youhuhuhuuu ahahahah baaststsrrddddd ha ahahaha a aahahahaha!!!!"

A slender tendril, no wider than a finger, managed to snake under Laura's blouse, and you can see its outline wiggling through the clothing, tickling Laura's belly. Her ticklish laughter, a sound you have heard far less often than she's heard yours, spills forth immediately.

Her laughter seems to attract the tickle fiends attention, because more and more tentacles make there was to Laura, ignoring you completely for the moment. Some join their mate and slide under her blouse, others slip beneath her skirt. A couple try and sneak into her shoes. Then, for just a second, they seem to freeze, even the one that had been tickling Laura's belly. Your former tormentor's eyes open, wide with fear.

"Oh, crap," Laura whispers.

With a loud, ripping sound, the tendrils tear her clothes into ribbons, leaving her in just a bra and panties. Tearing the cloth and leather seemed no harder for the beast than ripping tissues. Even her shoes are split in half. The tickle fiends strength must be incredible! Still, you can't help but marvel at the sight in front of you. While Laura's seen you undressed countless times, this is one of the few times you have had the advantage. You have to admit, despite your dislike of the woman, she has quite a body, with full breasts, firm legs and slender arms. Her skin is a pale white, contrasting visibly to the pitch black tentacles holding her.

As if on cue, all the tendrils start stroking Laura's body at once.

11112.content:
For a glorious moment, Laura ceases her torture!

"Now to make sure we don't bother any random passers by ..." says Laura, as she begins chanting an unfamiliar spell.

"Wait, Laura, please!" You beg breathlessly, "I can't take anymore!"

As Laura finishes her spell, you notice your desperate pleading is quickly reduced to silence! You continue to beg and whine, but no sound escapes your throat!

"Ah, much better." Says Laura, circling your helpless kneeling body with a look of pure evil on her face. "I get so bored of hearing you whine and moan."

You continue to whine and moan, as per usual, but it's useless! You've been rendered completely mute.

"I'm pleasantly surprised the Silence spell even worked." Laura laughs. "I found it in a rather dubious book of magic in the library. I never would have had the courage to try it on a competent sorcerer. But luckily, I have you."

How insulting! You stop your silent pleading for a moment and begin silently expressing your indignity.

"So," chirps Laura, sinisterly kneeling in front of you as her lips curl into a devious smile. "I'm going to tickle you until you ask me, politely, to stop."

You mouth "Stop! Please stop! Ms. Laura, please, most mighty Sorceress, please stop!" but, unsurprisingly, sounds continue not to issue from your throat.

Menacingly, Laura runs her glossy, jet black nails slowly from your stomach to your chest, before splitting and sliding toward your armpits! You begin to buck and squirm in your unrelenting hogtie as her fingers begin to dig and dance over your flesh mercilessly! You scream and beg but can't make a sound as Laura's evil cackling fills your room!

For a seeming eternity, Laura tickle tortures your underarms and prods and teases your bare nipples. Your head spins in a ticklish delirium! Just as you fear you're going to pass out from the assault you hear the door to your room creak open.

Laura stops her attack momentarily and you look toward the door, your vision blurry with the tears of agonized laughter, and you see Erica, a tall, athletic blonde fifth year sorceress and the mistress of your hall. Last semester she botched a Spectral Chains spell during finals, accidentally binding her own wrists and ankles. Professor Dweomer had found it so funny that he'd left her like that the whole rest of the day! Robbed of her shoes and socks, stretched taut with her arms above her head and her feet dangling several inches above the floor in the Hall of Restricting Magics, Dweomer had invited the rest of his classes to tickle and tease his hapless student. You, and countless other apprentice level students, couldn't resist the chance to assault the helpless feet of this advanced sorceress ... but did she remember you? You hope not!

"I was just doing my usual rounds before heading to the tourney and I thought I heard some evil cackling," says Erica, as Laura's face flushes with embarrassment.

"We were just practicing before the tournament!" Stammers Laura.

You mouth "We're done practicing now! Please get me out of here!" silently, while Erica looks on with a disappointed furrowing of her brows.

Already embarrassed and caught off guard by the blonde sorceress, Laura huffs and stomps out of the room and disappears down the hallway. "Don't mention it, I know what it's like to go through something like that." She says. "Even if last time you did tickle me." She adds while winking, then pokes your side.

"Shit! She remembers me!" You think to yourself as you laugh involuntarily from the poke, a sense of panic starting to well up after what you just went through.

Noticing your face take on a funny expression, she giggles softly.

"Relax, I'm not looking for payback or anything. Otherwise I would have left you tied up silly." She replies with a warm smile.

"Hey Erica, I was wondering do you want to help me find Laura?" You ask her, cause her to furrow her eyebrows in confusion.

"You want me to help you find the girl that was just torturing you?" She asks sounding confused, but also curious.

"Well yeah, we may be rivals, and we may torture each other, but we are still friends, well kinda." You reply trying to explain to the blonde sorceress.

Erica takes a minute to consider what you said, then her face relaxes and smiles.

"Hmm, I guess that makes sense. So do you have any idea where to look?" She asks you, starting to move toward the door.

"I have a few ideas." You reply and open the door, and then close it after you are both through it.

You lead her down the hallways and stairwells, until you arrive at a small triangular opening, one of many in the school, which was covered in grass and flowers. A few small stone benches sat pressed into the grass, upon which sat non other than Laura who seemed to be entranced in a book. So much so that she didn't look up until Erica and you were standing right beside her.

"What are you reading?" You ask the sitting sorceress, unable to see the cover of the book from the position it was in.

"W-Wha?! When did you get here?!" She says, clearly surprised and nearly falling off the back of the bench.

"We just got here, we were wondering if you wanted to go watch the tournament together?" You reply smiling at her.

Laura looks up at your face and then looks away.

"I-I guess I can spare some time to go with you, but don't think I'm going to enjoy it!" She exclaims. Though she is looking away, you swear you can see her face flush slightly.

Erica shakes her head, laughing to herself at the scene unfolding in front of her. Once Laura puts her book away, your group heads down to where the tournament is taking place.

Upon reaching the event, you can sense the numerous wards and safety spells that have been put up in the area to keep the onlookers safe. You also see many people recognize, including some classmates, several professors, and many other students from different years. Erica looks to Laura and you as you stop walking.

"So is anyone going to sign up for the tournament, or were you planning on just watching?" She inquires.

She allows herself a sinister giggle as she returns to the most ticklish spot; the soft flesh just below your toes. With one hand, she pulls back your toes, exposing the area. With the other, she wriggles her fingers intensely, rapidly gliding each nail across the vulnerable flesh.

You twist this way and that, pleading for relief. Your constant giggling is punctuated by shrieks and silent laughter. It is utter ticklish agony.

“Hahahaha!" you laugh, as you arch your back and tense your abs to hold the pee.

“Kootchy-kootchy-koo!” Laura cooes, as she rotates her fingertips in between your tender toes, lightly pinches your heels, scratches lightly at the ball of your foot and clawes along your arches.

And with that, the piss gushes from your penis, pouring all over your belly and bed.

Laura laughs evilly, a glint in sadistic eyes. She brings her face close to yours and whispers "Who owns you?"

"You do." you whisper back, feeling completely spent and utterly humiliated.
11321.title: Laura was cleverly faking, and utters a spell t...

choices: You cast the spell and summon a brilliant red feather duster
You bungle the spell, which instead forks to Laura and summons a silk glove
11322.content:
Before you can set finger to sole, you hear a riffling sound behind you. Turning, you see your spell book flipping through pages, seemingly in search of a spell to show you. You whirl and look at Laura, thinking it must be something she's doing to distract you . . . but she's still just lying on your bed waiting to be tickled, not even a hint of outrage in her eyes.

"I'll be right with you," you tell her, stepping over to see what your book's on about.

You're shocked when you have a look, because there's a spell that you can actually read clearly, no translation required. You've heard that some spell books contain nested spells, one triggering upon the successful casting of the previous, but this verifies the rumor for you.

''For direct manifestation of the sorceror's libido as an instrument of tickling . . .'' heads the page. You're able to read through a description of the particulars and feel a warm crawl in your guts. Oh, really?! Talk about a one-two punch! First compulsion, and then this.

"Laura, you're not going to believe this . . ." you tell her, feeling competent with the required phrase.
11322.title: The big bonus

choices: You tickle Laura's feet until she has a spectacular meltdown
You feather Laura's soles until . . . whoops! You make a mess of yourself
113221.content:
After saying the phrase, you find a feather duster in your right hand. The black wooden wand ends in a spray of bright red feathers: stiff feathers at the center, and fluffier examples around the edge. Not only does the duster look perfect, you also feel a deep connection to it. If Laura wasn't totally compliant right now, you realize it would be mortifying for her to see this. What an odd feeling!

"Hmm," Laura says from the bed, propped up on her elbows to peer at your duster. She seems interested and more than a little enticed. You'd never given much credit to the theory that opposites attract, but maybe it's true. You're more than willing to find out, circumstances what they are.

With a solid exclamation point of arousal digging into the side of your leg (you're glad to find the manifestation of your libido as a physical object doesn't affect its typical internal operating), you begin dusting Laura's soles.

Laura starts laughing at once, but makes no effort to pull her feet away. In fact, she's wiggling her toes in a distinctly amorous fashion, enjoying the tickling. The more energetically you feather her feet, the more frantically she wiggles her feet and toes about. You let out a choked gasp of intense passion, which would have had Laura in stitches if she was in her usual frame of mind. Except Laura's lying there, eyes closed, with something between a wince and a smile on her face. It's the most intriguing expression you've ever seen from her.

You have to pause for a moment, because you're getting so horny yourself that it's starting to hurt. Perhaps it's some sort of feedback loop, or an expected consequence of the embodiment of your desire being in direct contact with a pair of ticklish feet. Laura apparently needed a rest as well, her face extremely red as she gasps - and not entirely from ticklishness. The flush spreads down under her t-shirt, and you realize she's as aroused as you are.

"I wonder which of us will break first?" you ask her, feeling this could turn into a very strange variety of tickling tournament. The urge to drop your duster and hop into bed with Laura is strong, but not overwhelming. You'd prefer snapping her with a thorough tickling.

"Does it really matter?" she responds, before doing a very Laura-like thing and scooting down the bed a bit to try and press at your crotch with her right foot. That would have brought you off at one touch, but you dodged! Under the submission spell and simmering hormones, she's still Laura.

"Oh, yeah?!" you shout, going back to work.
113221.title: The dust of desire

choices: Who do I use the tickling submission spell on next?
What other cool spells am I possibly missing in the book?
1132211.content:
Continuing your feathering of Laura's feet, there's now the added spice of competition. In half a minute, you're both back where you left off, flushed and breathing heavily - though Laura's a little more winded than you are since she's still laughing with ticklishness, no matter how excited your feather duster is getting her in other departments.

Eventually, you reach a point of equilibrium. You're both gritting your teeth, trying not to give in to the overwhelming pleasure. You've been shifting the duster between Laura's soles, ankles, and the tops of her feet, which has left you as much on the edge as her. She's got double fistfuls of bedspread and an expression bordering agony, biting her lower lip between all the gasps and giggles. How best to push her over?

"Kitchie kitchie koo, Laura!" you say, with sudden inspiration. "Tickle, tickle! Who's a ticklish arch rival? Who likes to sneak around barefoot and peep through keyholes until she gets caught and tickled senseless?"

You continue with the verbal teasing, and you can see it's sapping Laura's resolve. She's actually trying to pull her feet away now, though not very effectively. You experimentally change tactics, getting off the teasing about her ticklish vulnerability and instead paying a few compliments as to how cute she is in her helplessness.

Jackpot!

"UnnnnggGHHH!!!" Laura manages to get out, sounding as though she's been dealt a mortal shock. She curls up, gasps several times, and then splays out on your bed, squirming around in the ecstasy she at last couldn't help surrendering to. This unmistakably sincere bout of rapture leaves you with your duster dangling, feeling your blood pounding in your temples. And other places. You're rooted to the spot, mesmerized as Laura writhes with pleasure in your bedclothes.

In half a minute, she's pulled herself together somewhat and doesn't seem at all miffed with this turn of events.

"That was..." Laura starts to say, gleeful at having survived the spasm of delight. She breaks off at once, eyes wide in amazement, and squeaks with a mixture of dread and anticipation. Having sat up, she now flops back down and resumes her earlier performance . . . with a lot more squealing.

So this is how it is for girls! You keep playing statue for several minutes as Laura continues on the roller coaster of bliss, complete with whimpers, a whispered mantra of "omigod!", and the occasional shout of astonishment as she discovers her own capacities. There are evident peaks and valleys in her experience, which seems sort of unfair. You only get one trip to the top, and then it's all downhill! On the subject of which, you're feeling the need to relieve some pressure yourself, and watching Laura's gymnastics isn't helping. Then you start worrying that someone will hear her from the hallway (it seems impossible they haven't already), and then she's apparently back on terra firma.

"I'm afraid to get up!" she tells you, looking extremely pleased with herself. Her forehead's damp with sweat and her hands are at her belly in an almost defensive gesture, but she's wiggling her feet around contentedly and favoring you with a wrung-out grin. It must have been exhausting, having that much fun.

"And to think I did all that just by tickling your feet," you tell her, grinning back.

Her mellow mood evaporates instantly.

"You are so vile!!" she shouts at you, launching out of your bed and stomping for the door. Is she genuinely offended, or did the submission spell just now wear off and make her despise you for what she'd been through while under its effect? She scowls furiously at you as she steps past, then spins on a bare heel and makes a grab for your head, pulling you in for a bruising kiss.

"Ow!" you complain at the forcefulness, though it wasn't all that bad. You couldn't have imagined this happening when you woke up today.

As you're still considering this development, Laura shoves you back onto your bed and hops back on herself, standing to tower over you. Thinking you're about to get your guts stomped out, you tense as she brings her foot down and . . .

"UnnnnggGHHH!!!" you grunt, feeling your eyeballs bulge with the release. You grab Laura's ankle and push against the sole of her offending/merciful foot, but she just laughs and doesn't try to yank away. She laughs maybe a little too much for your liking, but then that's Laura.

"Last touch!" she says teasingly, flicking you on the head with a finger before she walks out. You glance up long enough to confirm there's no tittering crowd in the hallway, and then she's slammed the door. You dropped your feather duster when Laura pushed you onto the bed, and you see it's starting to fade away as you make a futile grab for it. OK, that's something to remember.

Eventually, you toddle off to the ensuite for a freshen-up, but decide to leave the bed in disarray as a sort of trophy; against all expectations, your little encounter with Laura really hit the spot!

The pressing question might be, "Is Laura still my arch rival or . . . something else?", but you get around it by pursuing another question entirely.
1132211.title: Pushing Laura over the edge

choices: Laura cheerfully unleashes her glove on you, to your ticklish dismay
Laura's glove thinks you're a cute couple, so you both get tickled silly
113222.content:
Competence aside, maybe you just want to cast this libido manifestor too badly; you can hear yourself stumbling at the third syllable of the phrase and missing the proper stress on the fifth. You spend a second hoping it won't matter, and that your intent will take precedence over the raw mechanics of magical phraseology. You realize you've been hoping that a lot lately.

"What am I not going to believe?" Laura asks, and then jumps as a glove pops into existence on the floor next to your bed. It's one of those fancy opera gloves, long enough to cover a lady's entire arm, made out of something soft and shiny, probably silk. It's an intense shade of red, and it's also twitching a little. Uh oh . . .

The sight of the thing seems to break Laura out of her submissive lie-down. She looks between you and the glove with dawning horror, grabbing it up and shrieking.

"Get your filthy eyes off of it!!" Laura snarls at you, looking like she's soon going to start throwing punches. She's got the glove pressed tight to her chest, trying to hide it. You notice the glove seems to be twitching around even more now that she's holding it.

"Whoa, hang on, what's the problem?!" you say, hands out. "Look, I just messed up a spell, that's all."

"As usual!" Laura says, sneering. She's curious, all the same. "Which spell? No, don't try to show me, you idiot, it's your spell book, not mine."

You sheepishly put the book back down and give a basic description of the spell you just flubbed. Laura's got you uptight, waiting to be tickled one minute and then ready to clobber you the next.

"Oh," she says, seeming to understand. "Right. Well, I guess I wouldn't want you looking at that, would I? It feels very personal. I suppose you wouldn't mind waving around an avatar of your sex drive, but then you're a disgusting boy."

"It's a nice color," you say, at a loss for a stronger compliment. The truth is, you don't mind looking at Laura's glove at all. It seems to put your innards on a roil, though you won't tell her that.

"It's electric crimson," Laura says, looking down at the animate glove. "A twenty-button righty. That's some quality silk, too . . . weird."

Laura makes a face, realizing what she's critiquing.

"Err, I mean, of course it's quality, what else?!" Now she's showing you the glove defiantly while still looking shy about it.

"It looks really fancy," you say to her, seeing she won't take any teasing about the glove. "Why not put it on?" You wish she would, because the thing looks like it wants to make your acquaintance.

"I'm gonna put it on you," Laura says, looking as though she expects someone to burst in and tell her how naughty she's being. Once she gets comfortable with the idea, she hits you with a smoldery smile you could have done without. "Hey, come shake hands with my glove!"

"I'll pass," you tell her, backing toward the door. You take one look at that glove, fingers wiggling with menace, and know you're not going to escape.
113222.title: A glove that won't let you go

choices: It's Becky, wanting you to go to the library with her
It's Kelly, wanting you for a test subject
1132221.content:
"Get him!" Laura shouts, jabbing her finger at you. You stumble over your own feet trying to avoid the glove racing at you and go down. As you're reaching up to fumble at the door latch, you feel something snug around your ankles, cinching tight. Looking back over your shoulder, you see the glove's used its trailing end to bind you up and is now 'walking' its fingers back toward your bed, dragging you with it. You try clawing the floor to hold your ground, but your own digits aren't up to the task.

"Lemme go!" you yell, making a grab for Laura as you're dragged past her. She laughs and jumps out of reach, and the glove arrives at your bed. It shoots forward and coils around a foot on the bed frame, further binding your own feet up in looped lengths of silk. Is the glove getting longer? It has to be, to tie you up in itself this way. You try yanking and kicking loose, but Laura jumps onto your bed to hold it steady. After wearing yourself out with this useless maneuver, you lay on your belly and catch your breath. It's not long before you feel silk fingers undoing your shoelaces, the casual precision aimed to titillate - on which count it succeeds, making you glad you're on your stomach. You don't need Laura to see the tent you'd otherwise be pitching.

Craning your head around, you see Laura's on your bed, mirroring your position with her feet kicked up behind her. You'd been expecting plenty of teasing over your predicament, but she seems entranced with the methodically erotic baring of your feet. You don't think she's a closet foot fetishist, so maybe she's getting some sort of kinky echo back from the glove. What does that feel like? If only you'd gotten the words right on the spell!

Soon enough, you feel cool air and silk fingertips tracing along your feet. It tickles a little, but you know that's incidental; the glove's just probing for sensitivity. You don't want to let Laura know it's getting to you, but you can't help squirming around, trying to look annoyed rather than stirred up.

Except once the glove starts tickling, you let out a stupid yodel that no one with a brain could accept as a reaction of pure ticklishness. You hear Laura laugh a little at this, but it sounds breathy and distracted. She's tickled you plenty of times before, with magic and with her own hands, but she's never sounded like that. Where's the contempt of her rivalry gone?

This thread of thought is lucky to slip unscorched through the overheated loom of your head. It's bad enough to deal with the standard sensations of being tickled, but the added tension of becoming progressively more turned on with each touch of the glove's silk fingers makes you feel like snapping. Add in the distant awareness of Laura knowing exactly what's happening and getting worked up about it herself . . . it's too much input.

"Oooh, stop, stop!!" Laura commands her glove. Fortunately, it listens to her and gives you a break - both of you, by the looks of Laura. You catch your breath and enjoy her conspicuous discomposure. She's well aware of what's going on, but clearly hadn't expected this much fallout from rapport with her libidinal proxy. Despite being in no position for it, you can't help having a good chuckle at her expense.

"Oh, you shut up!" Laura snaps at you, getting off your bed and pacing around you, looking as though she's not sure how to proceed. "Leave off with his feet, I've had enough of that. Try for his belly instead."

Your feet are suddenly free, but Laura plops down on the small of your back, straddling you and preventing any attempt at slithering away. You groan for form's sake, but it's nicer than you would have expected to have Laura sitting on you. She seems more ambivalent about it, but fascination's winning out over aversion.

Meanwhile, Laura's glove has decided the easiest route bellyward, given your position, is straight up your right pantleg. The feel of silk running up your leg in one determined pulse marks the limit of your endurance, and that's that.

"Hrrcch!" you comment, quite involuntarily, despite your attempt to stifle the embarrassing grunt. Your buck your hips (just as involuntarily), which Laura mistakes as an escape attempt.

"Hrrcch!," she says back in mockery. "I'll 'hrrcch' you if you try making another break for it . . . Herkimer. I think that's your new name. Sit still and take your medi . . . what the . . . omigod!!"

You're feeling a little drained, but it's still hilarious. Laura jumps off of you at once, and then starts trying to wipe away the phantasmal feel of whatever's on her hand onto your shirt.

"THAT'S REVOLTING!!!" she shouts down at you, seeing you're trying to hold back a laugh. She's still trying to clean off her perfectly clean hand when you feel the glove becoming insubstantial. Maybe Laura was so grossed out that it terminated the spell? You suggest as much, which puts the brakes on her freaking out.

"Yeah, I guess," she says, still looking at her hand. "Eww, it was all hot and . . . ick." She stands there looking at you with her face twisted up, trying to cram the ordeal into the appropriate mental slot. "Nasty. And what do I get out of it, Herkimer?!"

It's a fair question, and you feel a sudden kick of gallantry.

"I could try the spell again. I think I can get it right this time, and then . . . "

"No, you'd just ruin it," Laura says, cutting off your eager plan of action. "You ruin everything. I'll manage on my own." Giving you a complex look of consideration and resentment, she moves for the door, stepping out and slamming it behind her.

Only to just as quickly open it back up, poking her head in and scowling at you.

"You're so gross," she says conversationally, getting one last look.

"OK, I'll owe you one, how's that?" you ask. But she's still got that complicated look on her face and won't be cajoled.

"Freak. Freak, freak, freak, freak. Freak forever, Herkimer, no redemption."

Having had the final word, she slams the door again and stays gone.

You repair to the bathroom to address the aftermath, wondering when you'll next have the courage to try that spell. What would have happened if you'd gotten it right?

Still thinking of how things might have been, there's a knock on your door.
1132221.title: Silk finish

choices: Hang out with Cindy and Becky for a probably useless, boring library search
Make your goodbyes and leave the library in search of more visceral fun
11322211.content:
You open the door and find it's Becky. You don't often see her without Kelly, so you wonder what she's up to. Has word about your most recent spellwork already gotten around? You can't believe Laura would have volunteered that information so soon.

"Hey!" Becky says, looking around a little nervously. Maybe she's afraid someone will see her visiting you alone; Becky's nowhere near as brazen as Laura. "Do you want to go to the library with me? I heard a rumor they released some rare stuff from the closed stacks, if you know where to look."

"You bet!" you tell her, grabbing your pack and locking the door behind you. You're always up for a look at 'declassified' material, because you never know what's going to give you an edge in a tickle competition. Plus, all the library staff like Becky because she's naturally quiet and not a nuisance, so she can smooth the way for a more aggressive sort like yourself who's on the prowl for rarities.

There aren't a crush of people in the halls today, so it's a quick walk to the stairs and then across the cloister to the library's north entrance. You get a cursory glance from the girl at the circulation desk and then follow Becky, who seems to know where she's going. There are plenty of short, parallel shelves and wire book racks here, the north end being the 'kiddy' end of the library sporting more fiction than reference titles. The middle of this section has carrel desks arranged in a large U shape with four reading tables at the center, the latter hidden from view of the librarian girl you just passed. There's laughter coming from many different directions, but it always sounds smothered in here; magical baffles liberally scattered in the aisles maintain a low noise level despite the laughing and shrieking going on in the maze of shelving.

"Ask her," said Becky, indicating the girl holding court at the table. You can see Becky's smirking, but you're not bothered by it.

Cynthia Amanda Boncaro. Affectionately "Checkers" to you (once), "Bonkers" to pretty much everyone else. The star student of anti-tickle magic in your school (and perhaps in the school's history), credits enough for an honorary M.Ma in countercraft . . . and held back from university placement because she refuses to tickle anyone. She has straight, short black hair (always immaculately combed) that's parted in the middle and grown precisely long enough to cover her ears. Dark green eyes that radiate blase indifference, never surprised by anything. An adherence to the dress code that would be annoyingly fastidious if not for the fact that her footwear consists exclusively of bright yellow over-the-knee socks. She's actually a year younger than you are, kicked up a level for precocity before everyone found out she was nuts. You'd had a monster crush on her a couple of years back, which she'd indulged enthusiastically, but it wasn't meant to be. "Just friends" had worked out all right for both of you. OK, so an untickleable girlfriend wasn't your thing, even though she'd let her guard down a few times. Hmm. You bet if it had been Cindy instead of Laura in your room a half-hour ago . . . that things would have gone even more disastrously wrong.

Meanwhile, under the gaze of your bittersweet ex-bf's eye, a couple of first years are attempting to retire the mystique of Cindy Killjoy; a pair of gingers, probably brother and sister, the girl with plaits working Cindy's right foot and the freckled boy delving into her left armpit. Cindy sits holding a very old issue of The Modern Etheric inverted in her right hand, looking for secret signs from past masters that bolster her kooky worldview. None of the three have noticed Becky and yourself peering around the edge of a carrel yet.

"Tickling is too narrow a focus for something as omniprevalent as magic," Cindy tells the young redheads, frowning slightly as though in deep thought over something she's seen in the magazine. "A non-physical implementation of will to restructure reality, and we use that power to tickle one another. We should be ashamed of ourselves."

"Then why are you here?" the girl asks, a noodle of pink energy extending from her index finger and wrapping around Cindy's foot. Zero response from Cindy, but the sock reveals a quick scroll of response, inky runes chasing across the yellow fabric before vanishing. Ginger braids is intrigued.

"To improve my skills, the better to defend the magically challenged from domination by unscrupulous tickling sorcerors," Cindy says, and the kids both laugh. One of Cindy's stock responses.

"Get the sock off, then," the boy says, sick of spidering his fingers on belly and ribs. You admire him for trying to tickle Cindy without magic.

Cindy promptly peels off her right sock, and you see she still doesn't use nail polish. Something quaint about that. The ginger twins pry her toes apart at once and try sawing a couple of 'plasmatic plumes back and forth.

Cindy's eyes grow round as she reluctantly snorts and then starts to giggle. She puts down her periodical and points at this between-the-toes attack with an expression of stunned disbelief.

"HahahaHAHAHAHA!!!" Cindy cries out, getting an equally stunned expression from her 'tormentors.' "STOPSTOPSTOP illdoanythingquitit PLEAHEEHEEHEEASE!!!" Both hands fly to the arms of her chair, knuckles whitening as she tries to brace herself against the attack.

"She's not even trying to move her foot," braids says to her brother in an angry mutter.

"Yes, sorry," Cindy says, instantly dropping the act. "But it was a valid attempt, and I do offer my 'Strategies in Agargaletics' pamphlet at a reduced rate to first years, so think it over and track me down if you ever get tired of being tickled."

"You're just . . . boring," the brother says, giving Cindy a dark look as she's pulling her sock back on. He and his sister stalk off, young egos wounded, and Cindy goes back to reading.

"I can feel you looking at me, Kevin," she says, so you step into view with Becky, both of you taking a seat opposite the unticklish phenom. "And the only thing that dynamited you out of your spellbook or the arena was gossip about restricted matter floating about. Though you haven't heard any specifics yet, and you want more details." She puts the magazine down again and smiles at you, which means she'll probably help you.

"Do you know anything specific?" you ask. "I've already picked up a strong combo today, so crawling all over the library looking for something iffy isn't real appealing. If you're interested, I'd really rather get your help as a practice partner." Now that she's right in front of you, the possibility of having Cindy in genuine ticklish distress has captured your interest. You've been down this disappointing road many times before, but you think the eroto-tickler spell would crack Cindy's defenses. Assuming you can get it right.

"Rain check," Cindy says, giving you a look from the corner of her eye. "Anyway, I promised to help Becky with defense so, time permitting, I'm taken. And what I'm specifically looking for is a suppressed treatise of Ibn al-Haytham dealing with noumenal perception, which I know is in here somewhere. What you're going to be interested in is a fragment from the Tractatus of Primm that supposedly allows for near-total reality dictation in a limited personal space, meaning you can turn your room into the tickling seraglio of your dreams! Of course, even if we find what we're looking for, we're probably not going to be able to understand it, much less make use of it. But I can tell by the stars in your eyes, Kevin, that you're imagining every girl who breaks the plane of your door getting instantly outfitted in a genie costume, so I've lost you already."

"Huh?" you say, distracted. You were just having a nice daydream, and Cindy does have a tendency to drone on.

"What do I want, then?" Becky asks, thinking she's getting sidelined in this quest.

"You want . . . " Cindy says, pausing to consider. "You want to know if there are any unofficial sequels to the Golicati Girls books you still secretly read, and there are - and one of them's hidden right over here, because I just got done with it a few days ago."

Becky squeals with delight, following Cindy over to the wire racks as they both chatter about guilty pleasures. You're left sitting to make a decision.
11322211.title: Shelf candy

choices: You, Cindy and Becky take off in search of the reality-warping tome
You and the girls find other people are also looking, which complicates things
113222111.content:
You decide to hang out, liking the sound of the cracked prim thing that Cindy had mentioned, whatever that is. Cindy and Becky soon return, still engaged in happy tittle-tattle about the ticklish adventures of some dumb chicks in an equally dumb series of chicks' books.

"So, Cindy, about the important stuff . . . " you begin, but she just nods and sits back down. Becky immediately opens her paperback (#11, 'Pass your Dreadtime', which apparently keeps the G Girls in pjs throughout if the cover art's to be trusted) and zones.

"I've got an angle," Cindy tells you. "I've been watching the newest crop of first years pretty closely, since most of them pass through here at some point. In fact, some of them are arriving in the library and mixing in, given the sorry state of administrative records after that fiasco last year."

"What do you mean, 'arriving here'?" you ask Cindy, too familiar with her strange theories not to know one when you hear it. "First years always come over on pedalos, dodge tentacular things in the lake, try to swim to shore if they go overboard, all that. It's a riot! Strike that, it's a rite of passage. They don't just wink into existence inside the library, where's the fun in that?"

"These newbies are from outside," Cindy says, with a wink that suggests she won't be elaborating further.

There's an unbroken row of bookcases directly ahead of the carrels, acting as a wall, but it fronts a corridor that anyone venturing into the north section of the library is obliged to pass through. Cindy's waiting and watching, and you finally get sick of looking over your shoulder, getting up to take a seat on the other side of the table with the girls.

"Here she is," Cindy says, and you roll your eyes. Her?! "Desi, pssst!"

Desi must certainly be one of Cindy's "outsiders," because the poor kid's too homely to be a local. She wears glasses that are too big for her face, has braces with orthodontic headgear, and apparently fell out of the wrong side of the ginger tree: her dark, coppery hair is styled into mismatched pigtails, each stabbing out at their own peculiar angle, and it looks like she used her face to stop a couple of shells loaded with double-ought freckles - was, in fact, probably kissing the barrel at the time.

"Train's a-comin', whoo whooooo!" you say, unable to help yourself. Desi ignores it, but Cindy and Becky both give you dark looks.

"Cindy, it's really working!" Desi the red menace says, indicating a charm bracelet on her left wrist. She puts down the stack of books she's carrying and flops down in the chair you just vacated, eyes wide in hero worship. Cindy inspiring that reaction from anyone seems all wrong to you.

"Just remember to work on your laugh, and try to be a little more spastic when you're struggling," says Cindy. Great, Cindy's got another convert. Not that you'd want to tickle this kid, ever, no pending miracle of puberty capable of redeeming those features.

"I'm not sure you'll want to look like any more of a spaz, Desi," you tell her, though you genuinely are trying to be helpful. Becky punches you under the table, quieting you down.

"We went out once," Cindy says in a low, apologetic tone, quirking her head at you. That's enough of a voucher for Desi. "But if you're up for it, I'm looking for something." Cindy dips into a pocket that probably shouldn't exist in her robe and retrieves a pen and pad, scribbling something down and passing it to Desi.

"Yeah, that one just dropped this morning," Desi says at once. "It's hiding in with the fifteeners. There's a big blue qaf on the front, look for that." You feel a little better when Cindy asks what fifteeners and qafs are, and a little worse when Desi explains the references and borrows Cindy's pen to draw something. Well, she had to make up for that face somewhere along the line, so a brain was the consolation prize.

"So you just know where books are in here?" you ask, sitting up with interest as you figure it out. That could be useful. "Hey, that's actually pretty cool. Some sort of branch talent of yours? Sorry about the train and spaz thing, all right?" Your ambition is a little too transparent, and all three girls groan. Desi actually looks at you instead of pretending you don't exist, so at least you're partially back in her esteem.

"Well, it is cool," you grumble. Women.

"He's looking for . . . " Cindy says, tapping at something else she's written down. She rips the leaf out of the pad and hands it off to Desi, who writes down what look like directions.

"Except you'll never be able to get to it, and you won't be able to use it even if you do," Desi says, looking at you with amused disdain. "Seriously, not being mean. They're both pretty heavy texts, but hers is more like theory and yours is dense, practical stuff that even masters skim through and give up on."

"I've done OK with translating a pretty tough text so far," you say, naming the family grimoire you've been working out of. It was hot enough to have Laura begging for mercy earlier! You think you can manage with this prim thing.

"Yeah, but that's an heirloom," Desi says at once, nearly losing some drool in her rush to be a know-it all. "But I know, 'none of my business,' so good luck."

"Ooh, ooh!" Becky chimes in, excitedly waving her G Girls book. "What about more of these?!"

"Those are so lame!" Desi says, but her eyes say something else. "You want the rare ones, right?" Even Cindy nods, so Desi takes it more seriously. "All right, I'll catch up to you later with those, they're easy. You guys can find the harder stuff yourselves."

Cindy and Becky thank Desi, and you belatedly squawk out your own gratitude as the kid wanders off.

"I am getting my Alhazen," Cindy says, just as you're opening your mouth, "and I can't see that I really need you to do it. That's pragmatism, Kevin, not snarkiness. But the Primm tract could be incredibly useful for both of us, and I think I know what Desi means about it being a tough acquisition, so . . . I'm up if you are."

"I'm in!" Becky says, automatically. She stops reading to look up with confusion, not sure what she just agreed to.

"You've got the paper, so lead on," you tell Cindy, more than happy to be deferential if you get what you want.
113222111.title: The card catalog kid

1132221111.content:
"Wow, it's spooky down here without anyone laughing," you say. You look around, seeing books stretching off endlessly on either side of you. The lighting's on the verge of being too bright, so this is the more serious part of the library. People aren't messing about while looking for assigned material or light reading, so it's also library-quiet.

"Isn't it nice?" Cindy asks, smirking as she gets her bearings. "OK, Desi has us going forward two more rows and then cutting hard right, and then we're in the general area."

"Uh, that's outside the library," Becky says. She has a good sense of direction.

"In a way," says Cindy, leaving it at that. She pads ahead, you and Becky following along.

As you make the directed right turn, you notice something's off. The shelving still looks the same, nothing appears to change, and yet you've got the sense the aisle here is somehow pinched. You can't actually see anything, but space looks a little twisted, like a refractive trick where you poke something in water and see it bend.

"What's wrong?" Becky asks.

"He can sense where the continua dovetail," Cindy says, squinting. "I can't. Keep your eyes open; this area's only nominally a library."

Before you can ask what you're looking for, a very large book suddenly tumbles over into the aisle, flopping down right in front of Cindy. It opens at once, spitting out a bunch of golden symbols on lengths of serpentine coils. Cindy gets looped by the coils around her elbows and thighs before getting dragged to her knees.

"It's a colophonascus," says Cindy, sounding interested rather than concerned. "You might want to stay back. I'm not sure how it'll respond if it can't get me to sing."

"Just . . . exactly what you say, Cindy," says Becky, making a point of stepping back a good distance.

You can see and barely hear the little symbols buzzing like mad, going for a vibrational assault. Six of them divide between Cindy's feet, pressing against her yellow socks. When she doesn't start squealing with laughter, they try to drag the socks off and are completely frustrated, not getting them to budge one yellow inch. They try behind her knees for some time, and then continue climbing. You can be forgiven for enjoying the sight of metal strands snaking under your ex's blouse, and it would be kind of nice if she suffered a major wardrobe malfunction right now.

"Naughty," Cindy says, again with no concern. "Trying to get past my underwear, but no dice."

"Like the socks?" Becky asks, and Cindy nods. You'd wondered about that, but Cindy has naturally done a good job of proofing herself.

"Still," you say, sounding keener on the point than you'd intended, "you've got buzzy things right over your, uh, bosoms and . . . you know. Just a layer of cloth for protection, even if it doesn't tickle."

"Kevin wants to know why I'm not groaning uncontrollably with pleasure right now," Cindy says to Becky, who squeals with laughter. "Because, Kevin, my clothing in general - and dainties in particular - are enchanted to allow me conscious mediation of sensory input; if I don't feel like getting tickled or stimulated by 'buzzy things,' then it doesn't happen. Yes, there's a panoply of other wardweave involved, but that answers your particular question regarding this circumstance."

"Oh, come on, give in . . . it'll be fun!" you say. It just slips out.

Cindy smiles, tries to compose herself, then goes back to smiling as she looks away from you. She's flattered that you're still concerned about her status in that department.

Eventually, the book gets sick of the unresponsive Cindy and withdraws its metal feelers.

Just before it lunges at . . .
1132221111.title: Bookbindery

choices: Yes, a nastier obstacle presents itself
You meet up with someone else
11322211112.content:
"Watch it!" Cindy calls, seeing the colopho-whatsis still wants a victim. She tries to grab onto it and force it shut, but it shrugs her off and starts hopping forward.

You shrink back, but it's not after you; it heard Becky's squealing laughter earlier and now wants to introduce itself.

"Ahhhh, you guys, help!!" Becky yells, pitching her paperback at the huge book. As she turns to run, the book launches a pair of markings at her, lassoing her ankles and bringing her down. Cindy has the presence of mind to cast featherfall, Becky settling gently to the tiled floor instead of smashing into it face first.

Becky's already laughing before she's reeled back into range, the metal buzzing at her ankles enough to set her off. The book promptly makes up for its earlier wasted effort, getting right to work as it shoots a couple dozen tendrils out, eeling right past Becky's clothes in its eagerness for her.

"Make it stop!" she cries out, laughing in a way that doesn't convince you she's being tortured. She sounds like she's having a good time, and you can see it in her eyes when she looks at you. She's got coils vanishing right down her socks into her shoes and boiling under her uniform blouse, but doesn't seem to be suffering any torment for the close attention.

"I think she's enjoying herself," Cindy tells you, smiling as she grabs one of the book's tendrils. "Look at that! The alchemical symbol for antimony." She lets it go, and it returns to tickling Becky. Her eyes are closed and she's started to squirm around, but it appears to be a release of nervous energy more than genuine distress. She sounds a little nutty, but not enough to try your nerves.

"Should we leave her here and keep going?" you suggest. "They're a cute couple. Come on, let's find this thing and get out of here."

"Kevin," Cindy says, giving you a look. OK, that's out. Anyway, you might need Becky to overcome a nastier obstacle later.

Becky keeps right on laughing. And laughing, and laughing. It's wearing you out just to watch.

"I'm about ready to sit down," you say, plopping to the floor and leaning against a bookshelf. Becky's finally getting a break, but doesn't seem ready to push on just yet. Cindy shrugs, following your example and sitting on the opposite side of the aisle.

"You guys can go ahead if you want," Becky says, trying not to sound too eager to get rid of you. Then she's back to laughing.

"No way!" you deny, shaking your head. "If this thing gets back down to business, I want to hear you squeak." Becky's laughing too hard to hear.

"Such a charmer," says Cindy, looking at you with perplexed annoyance. "You're going to be a model tickle sorceror, you know that?"

Before that slight can turn into an argument, Becky flips onto her stomach and starts pounding the floor with her fists, then kicking with enough energy for the two of you to give her some space. Despite the frenzy, the sound of her shrieky laughter doesn't suggest she's being pressured.

"See? We're so used to this sort of thing now that a friendly tickling can take hours! Benefits of an education in tickle sorcery."

"Yes, Kevin. Your logic is impeccable."

"I'm a friendly tickler now, you know," you tell Cindy, playfully going after one of her feet.

"No you're not!" she says, snorting with laughter: the incredulous type, not the ticklish kind. Cindy was always able to say a lot with a snort of laughter - and, as the disappointed kids noted earlier, she doesn't even move her foot away. "It's always going to be about control for you, humiliation, dominance . . . you can't help yourself."

"I'm just going through a phase," you tell her, winking. You don't care if she's not laughing or withdrawing her foot; it's still fun to make the motions.

Cindy looks a bit melancholy, watching your fingers versus her sock. She stands up and retrieves Becky's schlocky paperback. "Look, let's just grab her and keep going. We'll get your totally indecipherable book, I'll go back and get what I'm after, and we'll call it a day."

"It was sweet of you to insist on grabbing my book first," you tell her, but Cindy gives you a 'Whatever!' roll of her eyes. She grabs one of Becky's weakly flailing arms, and you grab the other. The book doesn't seem ready to stop tickling her, so you drag both of them along behind you. The floor's waxed, so it's not at all taxing.

Along the way . . .
11322211112.title: Throwing the book at Becky

choices: Cindy gives in, wallowing in mushrooms to her heart's content
Cindy somehow retains her composure and manages to walk away
113222111121.content:
As you and Cindy drag Becky and her dance partner along, you notice the shelves are starting to open up; rather than the single long aisle you've been walking down, you have new intersections breaking in and leading off in shorter stretches.

"Where did the kid say we're supposed to be looking again?" you ask Cindy.

"We're in the right area, but . . . we should have a few more surprises before we get there," Cindy says. "Sorry, Kevin, but we'll know we're closing in when we're seriously considering turning back. I don't think I'm invulnerable, so I've already considered the personal risk. Which is why we're going after 'your book' first; I want this out of the way, assuming it's something we can grit our teeth through and move past rather than have to admit defeat over, which is also a possibility."

"Glad you're considering all the options," you say, frowning. How badly do you want to turn your room into a nonstop tickling orgy, really?

"Oh, I can't . . . " Becky says, suddenly squirming around on the floor. That kind of squirming. It's lots of fun to watch, Becky's eyelids fluttering as she gasps and smiles, but Cindy drags you several rows distant.

"Jealous?" you ask Cindy. "You could have been doing the same, earlier."

"I'm just giving Becky her privacy instead of ogling," Cindy replies. A drawn out groan from Becky follows soon after, along with a very high-pitched giggle. Evidently, Becky can, with the right prompting.

Cindy blushes a little at Becky's enthusiastic moaning, but doesn't comment on it. "Have you noticed anything odd about the books in this wing of the library?"

"They're all in a weird language?" you say, grabbing one off the shelf. It's a blue book in a red dust jacket, the alien alphabet a series of interlocking circles with patterned dots in the empty spaces. You open the book and can't tell what direction to start reading it in. Still, it's in a very familiar book pattern, so it probably suggests the narrative proceeds from one page to the next. No pictures. You put it back on the shelf and shrug.

"Hmmm," Cindy says, breaking out her monocle. Oh, man! You thought she'd quit with that thing years back. It's nicely made, not a prop piece, both the chain and rim around the lens made of gold, but it's not the gimmickiness of the eyepiece or the fact that it makes her look like a nineteenth century robber baron - it's that she thinks she can see things through it. She grabs the book you just put back and opens it randomly.

"'. . . regarding . . . hesh . . . something-something . . ., which was seen to thoroughly caress hesh' - hesh, I think that's a pronoun - 'skexafuntish'? Even the monocle can't handle it. And while I can't get a complete translation, I'd make a bet on the content."

You shrug. Maybe it does actually say that, who knows? But you'd bet on Cindy making it up on the fly.

Cindy continues, quickly scanning through a few more books. You can still hear Becky crying out with enjoyment, but she seems to be tapering off. You hope Cindy doesn't see how interested those vocalizations have left you.

"Kevin," Cindy says, returning with her monocle tucked away, "I believe we're in brown wrapper territory. It's an entire library of facetiae. Dirty books. Pornography, in a more literal sense."

"Has it done anything for your skexafuntish?" you ask her, laughing when she nods eagerly. She's relaxing around you a little, revealing her sense of humor. Things are awkward since you stopped hanging out regularly to save face. Still, she dumped you, and you have to keep reminding yourself of that.

"The point being," she says, "I think we can expect more of what Becky's going through. For all we know, this library's designed to use our erotic fantasies against us. It's just biding its time, seeing what makes us tick. Talk about an obstacle! The entire library's our opponent, but it's operating in a sneaky way meant to overwhelm our various, uh, coping strategies."

"That's pure conjecture!" you bark, trying to sound scholarly. Good for a laugh from Cindy. "You're saying we don't have much to worry about, then? A little of what Becky's going through? Sold!"

"I doubt it's going to be that easy," Cindy says, looking around. Nothing jumps out at either of you.

Except Becky.

"Hey!" she says, looking to be in even better spirits than when she first started out with you. She can't hide the fact she's had an itch thoroughly scratched. The book that did it to her is now much smaller, compacted into a standard hardback. You ask her if you can check it out, carefully handling it by the edges.

"'Carmotically Yours' by Rubedo?" you say, surprised as you find you can now read the spine. "Hey, wasn't this thing in some language that looked like morse code at first?" You're reminded of your spellbook offering up a legible spell, earlier.

"Check the cover!" Cindy says. Whoa! The title and author are there again, but with a picture of Becky's face on the front! Artistically done in watercolor, but there's no mistaking the resemblance. Behind her face, you can see others silhouetted and trailing off in a long line. There's also a photorealistic eye painted near the top left corner, the jacket puffing up around it a little as though someone's dealt it a shiner.

"I hope the thing's self-cleaning, Becky," you tell her. "Looks like you're sloppy sixtieths." You manage not to burst out laughing as you say it.

"I don't care!" she says. "Kevin, could you put h . . . it in your pack for me? I want to keep him. Uh, it. Whatever. I'm bringing it out with me when we leave."

"No problem, Becky," you say, grinning. Cindy's smiling as well. The Rubedo goes into your empty pack, and Cindy puts the G Girls in after it. Cindy also explains her theory about the library you're in now.

"It's just going to have to go after you two, because I'm good for the rest of the day," she says, pleased with herself. "Let's go further down this way, the main aisle's boring."

"I don't wanna get lost in here," you say, because it seems it wouldn't be very hard to do. You have the distinct feeling this library wouldn't mind getting you lost inside itself for some time.

"Please," Becky says in dismissal. OK, so the girl can carry a map in her head. It's a straight shot back to the main aisle, so a little exploring can't hurt.

The three of you notice a sweet smell in the air as you proceed down a short row, then see that the bookshelves are leaning at drunken angles, books scattered all over the floor. Peeking over the tumbled shelves, you see a huge mushroom with smaller varieties scattered around. It's a tiny mushroom forest, and the fungus seems to be growing on and into the books that have hit the floor, breaking them down and leaving behind a residue that looks like crystallized honey. That explains the smell. The lights are flickering overhead (how, when you haven't been able to spot a light source since you entered the great hall of dirty books?), but there's a steady glow from a bank of mushrooms that shed a green bioluminescence. Weirdest of all, the king mushroom seems to have the screen of a computer monitor stuck in its red cap, integrated with it somehow. You can see characters flicking by rapidly, looking suspiciously similar to some of the text on the books.

"Hey, I think they're actually scanning the books as they eat them!" you say, tripped out. Becky trips out right along with you, but Cindy is looking . . . not herself. Her hands are in fists and she keeps clenching her toes.

"What's wrong?" you ask her. She looks at you, her eyes brighter than usual, then looks away again.

"You know what I said about the place possibly using our fantasies against us?" Cindy asks.

"What?!" Becky asks, wrinkling her nose. "Ewww, Cindy, no!"

"I think it must go back to a copy of Alice in Wonderland I had as a kid," Cindy says, trying to turn away and walk.

You're floored. WHAT?!

"Cindy, you've got a mushroom kink?!" you ask. "How? I mean, in the time we were going together, you never . . . "

"Oh, Kevin, use your brain! Would you admit to something like that? I knew it was too weird, so I never said anything." She can't help herself, stepping back to admire the mushrooms some more.

"I admitted to all sorts of stuff," you say, mostly to Becky. "I never would have guessed. So . . . what, then?"

"I want to get in there and stomp on them!" Cindy says, grinding her jaw. "I just wanna . . . roll around in there for a while. What do you think, should we?!"

You and Becky can't hold out, folding up with laughter. Cindy isn't bothered. Just when you think you know all about someone . . .

"But do you see what I mean?" she asks, now shivering a little. "We can't defend against this sort of thing. If something turns you on, how can you resist it when you don't want to?"

"Is there a magical equivalent of a cold shower?" Becky whispers to you. "I never learned that one."

"Cindy, I think you should have a good time," you tell her. This would classify as one of Cindy's more winsome eccentricities, and you're charmed by it. You can't remember when anything got her absolutely unglued like this, and you're a little worried she'll snap something critical if she doesn't give in to her desire.
113222111121.title: Cindy and 'shrooms

choices: Becky gets a secret longing fulfilled
You have a private wish granted
1132221111212.content:
Cindy makes her decision, though it seems a painful one for her.

"Can't," she says, taking several deep breaths and pulling herself together. "I can't do it. They're performing useful work, scanning in books, and I'd be destroying all of that industry and information. I'm walking. Here we go."

And Cindy does manage to walk away, getting back to the main aisle, waiting for you and Becky to catch up. You're simultaneously impressed and depressed; she resisted, but seems diminished by the victory.

"That's probably just the beginning," says Cindy. "There'll be something ahead for both of you, I'll bet. Unless your secret fantasy was getting intimate attention from a book, Becky."

"Well, thinking about it now. . . " Becky says, head inclined in consideration. You look at Cindy, who gives you the go-ahead with a single emphatic nod, so you dig your fingers into Becky's ribs. You drive her to her knees, but she still manages to shout out a request through her laughter.

"O, spirit of the kinky library in some freaky dimension that I have no idea where it is, please send a mushroom boyfriend, maybe a tickling one, to help out our friend Cindy who is still shuddering with shroom passion that she selflessly and heroically put aside, so give 'er a break!"

It's an eloquent enough request that you stop tickling Becky and help her to her feet. Cindy's looking both embarrassed and hopeful.

"If you get jumped by a mushroom, I'm staying to ogle," you tell Cindy. "I'm letting you know now."

"Can you blame me for keeping my mushroom fetish a dark secret?" Cindy asks rhetorically, but she's kidding. Your junk isn't, and you have to make an adjustment as the girls walk ahead of you. Seeing Cindy so helplessly turned on has you rock hard, which she couldn't have failed to notice but had enough class not to mention.

"Aha!" Becky says, out of the blue. You and Cindy have no idea what she's on about, but she points at the shelf to her left: there's a book with a glittering yellow mushroom on it, which stands out from all the imcomprehensible text. Becky grabs for the book, and that particular shelf swings inward, revealing a very short vestibule with a door. The walls are made of yellow brick, and the door opens with a push bar. It looks like an auditorium entrance. There's a note on the door, simply reading, "To: Cindy From: A Friend".

"Secret admirer," Becky mumbles while clearing her throat, nudging Cindy forward. Your face gets hot for a moment, but you smother the ridiculous sense of jealousy.

"I'm not sure about this," Cindy says, pausing with her hand on the bar. "We might be better off denying ourselves instead of indulging."

You groan with exasperation and push the door aside for her, which opens onto mushroom paradise.

It's all colors of biolume inside, though still mostly dim; you're able to make out some details, but your eyes have to adjust to the murk. There are mushrooms the size of houses, mushrooms the size of delicate little flowers, and all sizes in between. Fat ones, thin ones, tall and short, any color you can think of in as many different patterns. There's a lingering groundfog and wisps of haze over everything, and while it has the sense of a bounded space you're unable to see the perimeter. Although the more directly appealing aspects seem synthetic, there's no denying the wildness of the place. There's a smell in the air that's both minty and peppery, combined in a way that's alien. While it doesn't seem dangerous in here, you have the natural feeling of disquiet that goes with trying to make sense of too many unfamiliar details at once.

"You guys, I . . . " Cindy manages, looking like she's going to faint. Instead, she shucks off her uniform robe and sprints off, vanishing into a stand of mushrooms with only a swirl in warm mist to indicate her passage.

"Come on, I wanna watch!" you tell Becky, ready to charge off after Cindy. She grabs your arm and digs her fingers in.

"Kevin, don't be obnoxious. You'll live longer."

"Well, I think it's OK if we at least look around," you say, straining your ears for any sound of Cindy. You hear dripping water from many directions and a sighing noise reminiscent of the wind, but the air is still. It might even be getting warmer in here.

Taking a step into the mushrooms proper, you find you're walking into the things, the ground a mushy, springy mass. The mushrooms underfoot yield but don't break apart, but you have to watch your step. Cindy flew over them like she was at a track meet! You turn and see Becky's got the right idea, leaving her shoes and socks next to Cindy's robe before she steps in. You do the same and dump your pack as well, following after Becky while still trying to get an idea where Cindy went off to.

Now up to your knees in mushrooms, Becky sees one that strikes her fancy.

"Oh, big pink shroom!" she calls out, mincing over to a large one, twice as tall as she is. She tries jumping up and can't catch the edge of the cap, so you give her a boost and help her scramble on top. The entire thing starts to glow once she's standing on it, sinking up to her shins in the sponginess.

"Thanks very much!" Becky shouts through her cupped hands, directing her gratitude through the fathomless fog above.

Suddenly, there's light everywhere. Many mushrooms are pulsing out flashes of color, glowing, sparkling, and generally spitting lambency that screams "electric mushroom utopia." Becky claps with delight before reaching down to help you up next to her, and you both sit to watch. It's a comfy mushroom to hang out on.

"The place went off when you said thanks," you tell Becky. Now there's a drumbeat cycling up from somewhere. Maybe a lot of drums, percussion breaking out all over, but it's still more felt than heard.

"Maybe it was just coincidentally at the same time Cindy went off, somewhere," she says, winking, and you try looking around for Cindy again now that there's more light. Still no sign of her.

In the few minutes you're waiting, there are more gifts showered down from above.
1132221111212.title: Too mush of a good thing

choices: Your Merediths pin you down and tickle you senseless
The Meredith detachment wants to see your tickle sorcery in action
11322211112121.content:
You're looking up into the wispy fog hanging over the light show and mingled rataplan when you see something move. Then there are more of them, floating down. You direct Becky's attention toward the sky (ceiling?) and become convinced it's more mushrooms drifting in.

"Firecracker, firecracker, boom-boom-boom!" you hear, faint and getting louder. Someone's cheering? No, a lot of people. Specifically, a lot of girls!

"What now?!" you ask, but in a very happy tone because you know exactly what. "Becky, it's raining cheerleaders!"

" . . . " Becky responds.

Now you can see them clearly, from the soles of their Nike Staminas to their uniform shell tops, and especially up their skirts! There must be 40 or 50 cheerleaders parachuting in right now, the mushrooms beneath them flashing out landing patterns and guiding them in. They cheer all the way down, starting in with a new one. "R-E-B-E-C-C-A! Find out what . . . !"

You don't find out what, because Becky squeals with embarrassment and buries her face in pink shroominess. What now?!

"Becky, there's nothing wrong with cheerleaders dropping out of the sky, trust me!"

She finally looks at you, having much the same expression on her face that Cindy did earlier.

"I like boys, OK?" she blurts, looking more nervous than ever. "But a couple of years ago . . . I was in QI."

"Yeah," you say, dragging it out to prompt her. You're already liking the sound of this! "QI", or 'Quote Immersion', is an elective class where sorcerors can mingle with non-magical folks, aka 'Quotidians'. Usually, in your school, that meant a field trip to experience day-to-day life off-campus and usually get some tickle magic in on the local population. You'd skipped it, having some familiarity with the quote world, but most kids born into a purely sorcerous family took the class out of curiosity. Also, there's no denying it: sorcerors have the magic, but quotes have the culture. QI daytripping was an excellent chance to snag the newest movies, music, comic books, all that sort of stuff.

"We wound up going to a prep school, Uller Academy," Becky continues. "There was this q-girl there, and we sort of hit it off. All day. Yeah, go ahead and leer, it was almost entirely tickling! Anyway, I haven't forgotten her, and . . . you know, daydreaming and stuff. She shows up a lot."

Now the cheerleaders are starting to touch down, and you have a closer look. There are brunettes, blondes, redheads, even some with their hair dyed stranger colors. They stop cheering and roll up their chutes, laughing to each other as they stumble around in the shroomy terrain. There's a certain sameness about them, from their height to the sound of their voices to the way they move. Many of them talk at the same time and finish each other's sentences. The nearest examples are about ten yards away from you. You're thinking it's a trick of the fog or something, but then you think again.

"They're her aren't they?!" you ask Becky, excited. "They're all her, with some little cosmetic changes here and there! Clone cheerleaders in mushroom land! It's like a weird heaven I'd probably never have come up with on my own! Thank you, Becky and Cindy!!"

"Meredith Elle Pletcher," Becky says out loud, but dreamily and mostly to herself. She sits near the edge of the pink mushroom, legs dangling, obviously thinking much the same thing you are.

With their parachutes (all red with white spots) folded and gathered in a tidy stack, the one Meredith who's squad leader calls out commands to get the rest aligned as neatly as possible. Ah! Meredith is stacked quite tidily herself, 32D, almost certainly, which suits you; 5'7" and maybe a shade under a trimly muscular 130 pounds. Scandinavian features with just a hint of corn-fed provinciality - probably originally a blonde, just like the squad leader. Leader Meredith is probably the template, which would make sense. Becky knew what she was doing when she went after this one! Cindy's not at the top of your list right now, but hey . . . a stiff dick has no conscience. Plus, the Meredith squad arrives with no strings attached; Cindy's a former girlfriend, Becky's a friend-friend. The Merediths, you strongly suspect, are created only for pleasure, so there's no chance for complications.

They're making their way over to you now, probably because the rest of the shrooms have stopped flashing so urgently except for the stalk of your own, strobing an urgent pink. They're not moving in lockstep, each of them quite naturally doing their own thing. They're not robots, and there's no suggestion of a stifling uniformity to them despite their all looking almost exactly alike. The more you see of Meredith, the more you like her. You do a quick count and see your earlier estimate wasn't off by much: 42 of them, since they all have numbers on the right side of their tops (#42, a platinum blonde, closes the series). All of them are in short skirts, white with maroon stripes, matching tops (a UA logo in maroon on the left), and mostly 'rabbit ear' ponytails, though hairstyle doesn't seem to be enforced. Their bloomers are royal blue, which you noticed as they were inbound.

"Becky," they say as one, gathered in a semi-circle beneath you. Becky, looking deliriously happy, seems to have no qualms about her earlier claim of being 'good for the rest of the day' and wordlessly stage-dives into the arms of her secret daydream gf.

You wait a respectable time before announcing yourself.

"And I'm her good friend, Ke . . . hey, wait up! Hold on a second!"

The Merediths are carrying Becky off somewhere and not paying the slightest attention to you. You have to jump off the big pink shroom and walk quickly after them, waving your arms around.

"Hey, Becky, how about an introduction?" you finally have to call to her. This isn't going quite the way you'd imagined.

"Oh, sorry!" Becky calls out, getting her wits about her. "Merediths, this is Kevin. He's my friend from school, and he's a tickle sorceror, too. We're here with Cindy, but she's . . . off doing her own thing right now. We'll probably see her later."

"Hello, Kevin," the Merediths say to you. Bright tones, politely friendly, nothing more.

"Becky, do you think maybe . . . " you say, trailing off. You hate having to ask, but it's becoming obvious to you that the Merediths only have eyes for Becky.

"Hey, would any of you like to hang out with Kevin?" Becky asks, the Merediths putting her down so she can converse in more dignified fashion. "Thanks. Any of you? He's a mostly decent guy, and there's no way I can handle all of you myself!"

Now it sounds like 42 girls standing around talking all at once, each trying to say something and no one synching up. Mostly debates about dividing into groups and who gets access to Becky first, for how long, to what degree, on and on.

"OK, I'll hang out with Kevin for a while," says a black-haired Meredith. Number 21. You actually thank her, which doesn't do wonders for your ego, but what the heck?

"He's a boy," Becky says. "He's a visual type!"

There's a bit of a sigh over this, but the Merediths get it. 42 steps up to act as a bookend to 21, a carroty redhead joins (13), then a toffee blonde (17), a chestnut brunette (4), and the one with light blue hair (36). A six-pack of Merediths suits you just fine!

"Thanks, Becky and Merediths!" you say, genuinely grateful. Becky and the Merediths tease you, but seem to find you amusing. "Uh . . . and thank you, whoever's up top!" That was likely a wasted bid, nothing dropping down for you, but you're happy with what you already have.

"Have fun, Kev!" Becky calls out, proceeding off with her three dozen playmates.

"Ladies, where to begin?" you ask, grinning at your loaner harem.
11322211112121.title: The Merediths

choices: Get the rest of your Merediths barefoot by way of D.O.F.
Bras and bloomers fit pretty tight! Fuzz your squad down to nudity
113222111121212.content:
"So how do you become a tickle sorceror, anyway?" Meredith 21 asks. You know you're not going to want to refer to them so impersonally, so you take the easier route and mentally nickname her Raven. You do the same for the other five Merediths now on your 'team,' the lengthy pause making the girls think you're really considering how to answer Raven's question. Too-Blonde, Carrot Cake, Shockwave, Conker and Gin Fizz. They'll probably be charmed, once you tell them.

"You first demonstrate some ability for magic," you say, being careful to look Raven directly in the eye rather than lingering further south, "then it's determined that you're a sorceror rather than a magician, mage, wizard, enchanter, or conjurer . . . I know, all those sound like pretty much the same thing, but there are overlaps and differences between classes and . . . I don't think you're that interested."

"Really, more about the tickling part," Carrot Cake says, thinking you're about to go off on some excursus regarding magical categories. She doesn't know that it's taking a lot for you to stand here chatting instead of getting to work, but you're having fun as you see how long you can deny yourself. It's a decent way to break the ice, too.

"Tickling sorcery, right," you say. "A lot of people think it's silly, but it evolved as a system of distraction cantrips useful in magical duels. That's the textbook definition, anyway. In other words, if you're squaring off against another magic user, the ability to get a simple spell off quickly that breaks their concentration before they can throw a fireball or something at you means you have the upper hand. And then someone decided to carry that logic forward and completely subdue their opponent with tickling rather than just distracting them before they threw their own fireball, and you wind up with tickling as a valid form of magical combat.
